Results.ReviewText: Probably the best service, quality, choices that you can have for any price

Results.Title: I really love Prism
Results.ReviewText: The one thing I would like to see is more ON Demand Free Movies and TV Shows. Otherwise I am very happy with Prism

Results.Title: Not worth the aggravation.
Results.ReviewText: We have had CenturyLink internet service for many years with no issues at all so I thought Prism TV would be just as good. I was totally wrong. We have had Prism TV since October 2012 and I have had to call technical support at least twice a month. I have to reset the boxes at least one a week because the picture freezes or becomes choppy. The only good thing about Prism TV is the channel lineup and DVR. I am just not happy with this service at all and cannot wait for my contract to be over.

Results.Title: Great choices and great service
Results.ReviewText: There is much to applaud and little to complain about with Prism TV. Outstanding customer service, great picture quality, fast channel changes and an ambitious DVR product make CenturyLink an easy choice over competitors. I am always excited to see what's coming next, and am rarely disappointed. I do wish that there was access to Watch ESPN / ESPN 3, and more English Language international programming, but otherwise, I'm hooked.

Results.Title: Good, but still has digital issues.
Results.ReviewText:
Great system, but still getting digital dropout on some channels. I thought this was just growing pains for Prism, but it is not getting any better. I know one Prism customer that wants to cancel because Prism cannot fix their picture freezing and dropouts. My main DVR box re-boots now and then and/or completely freezes up and I have to re-boot it. Sometimes the DVR stops recording for no apparent reason.

The limit of two HD recordings at a time is absurd! If I want to record three or more shows, I must record them in non-HD mode! What a waste of a HD TV set! There should be no limit to recording shows or watching on TV on a set-top box. I have five boxes (TVs) and can only use four at a time unless two of them are watching the same program.

Results.Title: The picture CONTINUALLY freezes up.
Results.ReviewText: You can wait a long time on hold for a service tech and you will have to call frequently.

Results.Title: It's good, but it is not outstanding.
Results.ReviewText: With our prior provider, we got English channels with translated sound to Spanish (we're not talking Spanish channels like Telemundo or Univision, but TNT, USA, and others...). Although the service does not go away with storms -like with dish antennas- the image freezes from time to time for anywhere between one to five seconds.

We many problems with Prism since our installation 2 years ago, mainly with picture freezing, cable going down with no use of my computer for anywhere from 2 - 20 minutes, 1-2 times a day. It finally seems like these issues have finally been fixed. I wish that when I want to record a show that has already started, that it would record from the start of the show. Sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. It's upsetting with some shows that if you miss the first few minutes, you lose the gist of the entire show. I wish there was more grouping of like shows, ie: putting all "shopping" shows together. Perhaps make it a 'cafeteria' style plan where one doesn't have to pay for shows they never watch. Overall, I am pleased with my Prism.

Results.Title: Better than regular cable. Cheaper than sat.
Results.ReviewText: For the money (when bundled with other services) it is better than satellite. I do get a bit of the picture freezing and my computers losing connections, especially when I'm using my iPod and viewing high graphics pages. I really miss the NHL network that was available on DirecTV.

Results.Title: GOOD
Results.ReviewText: I REALLY ENJOY PRISM TV. I GET GOOD PICTURE QUALITY AND CUSTOMER SERVICE IS GREAT ON SOLVING ANY PROBLEMS THAT ARRIVE IN A TIMELY MANNER.

Results.Title: innovative and enjoyable to watch but expensive
Results.ReviewText: I love the look of the new video store but it doesn't make it easy to find a selection unless it's brand new. I feel that the price of the service is too expensive but overall I enjoy it more than other available options (cable or satellite). It would be great to select the channel that you want and pay less for the overall service.

Results.Title: Router freezes and problems with Internet service
Results.ReviewText: Prism TV & the router still has some problems. We have had Prism TV since June 2012 and the TV freezing has stopped but the Internet doesn't always work. We have to restart the router several times a week.

Results.Title: It works
Results.ReviewText: Prism is good, but it could be allot better. Can only record 1 HD channel, but cannot watch another HD channel at the same time. I cannot watch 2 different HD channels at the same time, which is really unfortunate. Otherwise service is OK. On the remote unit when changing channels the signal pixilates and freezes for a second then it clears up. Service is good, but there are some improvements that could make customers a little happier.

Results.Title: not good
Results.ReviewText: not enough DVR recording, streaming drops or freezes fore the amount we pay for all the on demand now I find I have to Pay extra for getting it for my laptop / smart cell

Results.Title: Could be better.
Results.ReviewText: If we are watching TV and someone is using internet on a computer and someone else is accessing internet on their phone all three services slow down and the TV program will freeze. I need more detailed parental control such as blocking specific things that are TV 14. For example, there are many tv 14 shows I want blocked because of dialog. But My choice is to block all tv 14 or no tv 14. Hence there are some nature shows that are tv 14 for violence that I want the kids to be able to access without me having to unblock them every time.

Results.Title: like picture quality overall a little above averag
Results.ReviewText: I wish that there were more on demand local channels like fox, abc and cbs. Our picture goes out a lot for about a minute at a time and the internet connection.

Results.Title: I like everything about this but how it functions.
Results.ReviewText:
From the get-go we have had trouble with the box and TV synchronizing. Turn one on and the other stays off; or one off and the other stays on. Then figuring out what button to push on the remote to make the other correspond remains frustrating and upsetting. My husband swears he'd never get this product again. (We do love the DVR.) Since we bundle, I love the speed of the internet and our phone service is excellent. But watching TV and constantly being frustrated with the box and TV not synchronizing, is a big problem in our family.

I also wish in your TV line up you would get God TV.

Results.Title: Programming could be better.
Results.ReviewText: If the networks put out any more reality type of shows, you should complain. Tthey are diminishing the value of your Prism product. I would rather watch repeats of shows from past decades than to waste time viewing a reality show. They have become so numerous it is impossible to find anything to watch some evernings. The Hallmark movie channel and classic movie channel shows do offer some relief. The Science channel and "how is it made" shows are well done. USA, TNT, TBS, Discover and Nat. Geographic are also channels I do watch. Of course, CNN and CNBC are OK news programs,

Results.Title: Poor
Results.ReviewText: Can't record program while watching another channel

Results.Title: Leaves a lot to be desired.
Results.ReviewText: The things I DON'T like about Prism TV: (a) Only one HD connection so when I want to watch something and record other things I have to record it in non HD and the picture is totally distorted making everyone look fat and heavy; (b) Channel lineup is poor in most cases with poor programming; (c) The guide leaves a lot to be desired. When you pull it up the picture is still behind it and it is very hard to read; (d) Limited ways to use the guide. Mandy of the channels cannot be found in the local paper directory of what is on. If I want to look for sports items or movies etc. I have to go through everything on the guide to try to find what sports are on. Why can't we just have an option to choose something like "sport" and only search those channels that have sports on like the other providers offer: (e) the boxes in the house do not sync and therefore if 2 people are watching the same channel in say the living room and the kitchen, one is HD and the other isn't and the sound is not in sync so you hear an echo because they are saying the same thing but one is delayed; (f) If you change stations, the volume is different on each station and you have to adjust it; (g) If you want to try to record something, you have to goo to it in the guide and then go to information to find out if it new and not a rerun. Couldn't all the new shows that have not shown that episode be marked with an (n) in the guide rather than being so cumbersome then if it is a show you like, you can just record it rather than going through the other steps. I don't know if I will stay with Prism in the fall.

Results.Title: Over priced for the service.
Results.ReviewText: Channel line up is minimal. Includes channels that have no applicability. I live in Florida, a Chicago news and weather channel are not important to me. Internet service is good. TV picture often freezes. System will "lock-up" for long periods. Price has risen significantly (nearly doubled) in one year with no additional service. Not a worthwhile service.

Results.Title: average
Results.ReviewText: Picture freeze, when you recode a program to jumps or freezes . when you are with out services or picture credit is awe full .

Results.Title: For the price it could be better. old taylor
Results.ReviewText: I am pretty sure it is fed from the triangle but it would be nice to have the TV stations from down east available also.

Results.Title: Overall excellent product and service. Thanks!
Results.ReviewText: Overall excellent reception and service (when needed). Only complaint is with the latest channel line up. Thanks for expanding the offering, but the listing you sent (and provide in your office) is in numerical order. It is EXTREMELY difficult to find a station without visually scanning most of the list. It would be very helpful if you also provided a listing in alphabetical order. Much more user friendly.

Results.Title: channel line up is confusing now that it has chang
Results.ReviewText:
I only can afford basic so having so many channels is ridiculous.
With the change I lost good channels and have more sports, shopping and church channels that I don't want. Why can't we choose so many channels that do not include premium but regular stations. sorry, but you asked.

Results.Title: Slow Internet and Picture Freezes
Results.ReviewText:
Picture freezes often and internet often will disconnect by itself!
Very annoying looking for new service now.

Results.Title: Product is not reliable
Results.ReviewText: I will switch at my earliest convience. It freezes all the time and has pixels. Nothing anyone can do about it, so they say. Reseting the box in the middle of a show multiple times a week should not be acceptable.

Results.Title: confusing
Results.ReviewText:
same movies over and over and over.
I expect to down-grade as a result.

The monetary value not there and remote control operations are out-dated---it takes me 4 moves on my remote to turn on my TV !!!!!!!!!!!!!

C'mon--you hafta do better than that!
Dan.

Results.Title: Poor picture quality on Non HD and Picture Freeze
Results.ReviewText: Someday this will be a good product but not now. There are too many picture freeze ups. We can only watch on one HD stream at a time and the non HD picture is bad. Will not keep this service.
I wasn't crazy about the visible cable running through my bed room.
